page.title: 11SHEEP
page.content:
We divide our flock into two groups, the first lamb in January to produce lamb for the Easter market. The second group is March. The breed used are Scotch half bred and Mule ewes mated mainly with Suffolk and Hampshire rams. The best lambs are gradually fattened on grass, kale and turnips for marketing throughout the rest of the year.
We would like our sheep to have twin lambs every year and the nearer we are to this target the more economic lamb production becomes. The sheep are sheared once a year in June and the wool is sold to the Wool Marketing Board, where it is graded and used for clothing, carpets etc. An average fleece weighs 3.5 kilograms. By Serena
